mediaList.caption: Een bolletje truffel salami, heerlijk bij bijv een linzen soepje

reviews.title: Tongue Caressing, Eye Dazzling
reviews.text:
-I buy my Delicacies here!!! 
The chocolates, the truffle salmi and delicious cheeses, but also the quiche, the meatloaf, and much more, but you just have to discover that ...

In addition, I always get the beautiful Gastronomic Magazine..

The name is now Gastrovino. Vermeijden was the previous owner and founder of this beautiful store on the Nieuwe Binnenweg Rotterdam

photo.caption: Een bolletje truffel salami, heerlijk bij bijv een linzen soepje

reviews.title: Terrible staff and service
reviews.text:
Last Saturday my dad asked me if he could come over to grab some coffee. He has been through a lot and this was the first time he visited a horeca spot in over 3 years. Him offering to go by himself was a big deal to me. 
After having some great experiences with Vermeyden's takeaway sandwiches, I offered to go here. 

The ordering process was already arduous and confusing. I was used to ordering from the takeaway menu (as it turns out to be) and so we did. When it became known to the staff that we were having a seat for this meal, we were pointed towards the ''horeca menu''. I asked if we could still just order of the normal (apparently  takeaway) menu and we could, beautiful! These almost 10 minutes of ordering went with overall attitude, sighs and snarkiness.

I forgive the usual slow pace of the staff when they prepare the sandwiches. I tell myself it's made with love. And sighs.

My dad wanted to treat me and we sat down. When we were seated, he asked me if €28,50 for two (half-baguette which are never a half-baguette) sandwiches and two cappuchino's could be right. He felt too uncomfortable to ask about it at the register. 
The sandwiches are served and I ask the girl if she could give me the receipt and check if it's right. We eat and drink our meal in suspense of the answer (little uncomfortable), at least 10 new customers are served and nothing yet. When we have finished the plate and the cup, I walk towards the register while noticing another customer sitting down with her takeaway sandwich and orange juice in a plastic bottle. I ask the girl at the register if she had checked the receipt: ''Yes, it's correct!'' and proceeds to do her chores. 
Still utterly confused I ask her to elaborate. The receipt says cappuchino €4 a piece, miscellaneous €7,50 x2, extra charge €2,75 x2. At this point I am even more confused. 
When you use a plate and a cup, you pay more. Fair enough, however this was never mentioned while ordering and we even checked whether it was possible to order off the takeaway menu. If I would have known using their china would cost me 10€ more, I would have ordered it to takeaway. This is exactly what I told her. The younger girl was very nice but not very assertive and turned to her colleague/boss asking if there was anything they could do. Her colleague/boss whom we ordered with, turned around and asked ''oh, what's going on?''. She was 20cm removed from her colleague and clearly listening to the entire conversation.
I decide to not mention this and explain everything, again.

With more attitude, sighs and snarkiness, I got back 6€ with a vague explanation. 
Now I am aware that eating in should cost a little more because of the service (ahum) which was clearly lacking. For me it's not about the money but if you dare to charge these prices, first of all do it consistently (meaning that other customers don't sit down with their take-away) and with a true sense of hospitality. 

Overall, I am very dissapointed after coming here for my weekly weekend stroll. I just wanted to share the usual great experience with my dad.

reviews.title: delicassy has a name
reviews.text: The Vermeyden Delicatessen offers delicassies of all varieties. I should advice not to go there because taking a peek will make you buy stuff. It is just so fingerlicking good one can't withstand it

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for fall travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Explore fall travel destinations, vacation ideas and things to do, and get information on when and where to see the best fall foliage.

articleContent.title: Where centuries-old traditions continue to inspire

seoInfo.metaDescription: A visit to Japan is incomplete without experiencing the Kansai region. Regarded as the country’s cultural heart, it’s home to cities like the ever-popular Kyoto and the towering culinary hub of Osaka—this year’s World Expo host.
How to make the most of three days in Majorca from exploring seaside villages to the best seafood restaurants to epic views and more.

tripContent.title: Enter the unknown: Nevada’s wildest hidden realms
tripContent.description: Strange, surreal, and totally unforgettable, this is Nevada off the rails. From alien highways to haunted hotels, and from outdoor art playgrounds to eccentric ghost towns, this route is made for the curious traveler. Embrace the uncommon and uncover a different side of the Silver State, where ever stop feels like a secret waiting to be stumbled upon.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

tripContent.title: Chase horizons and conquer trails across Nevada’s rugged backcountry
tripContent.description: Nevada’s wild places were made for those who move at their own pace. Wander through desert canyons, alpine lakes, and ancient rock formations, all in one trip. Whether you're chasing stars in a dark sky park or breathing deep in the high mountains, this is the untamed side of the Silver State, ready to be roamed, hiked, and discovered.

seoInfo.metaDescription: Whether you want to hike through epic backdrops, ski in storybook surroundings, or bathe in mineral-rich pools, Türkiye’s fabled landscapes are as varied as the adventures they contain. Looking for something a bit different? Go intrepid on your next trip with our pick of offbeat experiences in some of the country’s most magnificent, yet undiscovered, regions.

reviews.title: Vergaande Glorie.
reviews.text: Helaas is het niet meer wat het onder de familie Vermeyde was, met 80% gedaald, hebben vaak niet waar je voor komt, en nemen ook de telefoon zelden op.

reviews.title: Lekkere kaas
reviews.text: Vermeijden verkoopt veel verschillende kaassorten en bij hun broodjesafdeling is het stokbrood 'Oud Rotterdam' (met truffelmayonaise) niet te versmaden. Ik zou er vaker iets willen halen, maar mijn budget laat hun prijsniveau niet vaak toe.

reviews.title: Vermeyden
reviews.text:
Enorme keuze belegde broodjes, superleuke bediening, leuke zitjes met uitzicht op winkelstraat. Ken de winkel al meer dan 55 jaar maar dit is op zijn best
Theo

reviews.title: een teleurstelling
reviews.text:
een luxe delicatessenzaak met mogelijkheid tot consumptie. Helaas werden wij bij binnenkomst nauwelijks opgemerkt en niet begroet en duurde het te lang eer er iemand kwam vragen wat wij wilden. Let wel, wij waren de enige "gasten" dus aan de drukte kon het niet liggen.
Ik ken dit bedrijf uit de tijd dat Henk Vermeyden nog de eigenaar was, dat waren betere tijden.

reviews.title: delicassy has a name
reviews.text: The Vermeyden Delicatessen offers delicassies of all varieties. I should advice not to go there because taking a peek will make you buy stuff. It is just so fingerlicking good one can't withstand it

reviews.title: Heerlijke lekkernijen
reviews.text: Voor goede wijn, vleeswaren, kaas of een lekkere koffie mét taart of chocolade is dit een uitstekend adres. De moeite waard als je even van je voeten wil na een lekkere wandeling over de nieuwe Binnenweg.

reviews.title: Top tent!
reviews.text:
Vermeyden weet wat delicatessen zijn. Met een mooi, breed en diep assortiment bieden ze veel lekkers.
Je kunt er terecht voor een lekkere bak koffie.

reviews.title: De "V" van verrassend!
reviews.text: Toevallig voorbijgelopen en verrassend goed meegevallen als kleine hap of om even te coffee-pauzeren. . Geen alledaags of ook net om de hoek maar prima verzorgd. Net iets anders en dat vind ik prima !

reviews.title: Eenheidsworst met een chique verpakking...
reviews.text: Regelmatig geweest, geen variatie en de eigenaren wekken de indruk, ook al is het vroeg, iets teveel gedronken te hebben. Elke dag hetzelfde aanbod en het personeel in niet vooruit te branden.

reviews.title: Heerlijke lunch en wat een geweldige zaak.
reviews.text: Samen met een vriendin heb ik hier geluncht na een bezoek aan de zaait markt van Rotterdamse Oogst. Wat is dit een geweldige delicatessen zaak en je kunt er ook nog heerlijk lunchen. Mijn vriendin nam een heerlijke dagverse salade met gerookte zalm, de dressing heeft ze gekocht voor thuis. Zelf heb ik genoten van een broodje Old Rotterdam, rijkelijk belegd met oude kaas, rosbief, truffeldressing en kappertjes. Na de lunch heb ik verschillende delicatessen mee naar huis genomen om daar nogmaals van te genieten.
